title: Strictly's Kevin Clifton jokes he'll find way to get to final amid replacement drama
text:

Kevin Clifton joked that he had to "get in the final one way or another" after replacing Neil Jones.

The professional dancer replaced his injured colleague, partnering up with Alex Scott, for Saturday night's Halloween special.

When asked about stepping in at the last-minute, Kevin said: "I've got to get in the final one way or another, ain't I."

The rest of the celebs and pro dancers were left in hysterics, while presenter Claudia Winkleman had her head in her hands laughing.

Fan favourite Kevin, who was the second dancer to get knocked out with Anneka Rice, did point out that it was not about him.

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

He continued: "This is not about me, it's about Alex. She’s been so amazing. For a couple of hours she’s been guiding me through the routine.

"This is a real test for her. I’m just going to do my best for her and for Neil.

While Alex added: "He's been amazing."

(Image: BBC)

(Image: BBC)

Neil was ruled out of the Halloween special after picking up an injury in rehearsals.

This meant that Alex had to teach Kev her entire street commercial routine in just a matter of hours.

There was some controversy as certain viewers insisted that Gorka Marquez, who did not receive a partner this year, should have been drafted in instead.

(Image: TV Grab)

(Image: BBC/Guy Levy)

Former Strictly pro dancer, James Jordan, tweeted: "Kevin to the rescue...."

Minutes later, he added: "Shame they didn’t use Gorka to step in for Neil....."

This was backed by lots of Strictly viewers on Twitter , as one said: "Nothing against Kevin but I wish it was Gorka"

"I love them both but Gorka was gutted not to have a partner this year so should of been," added another.

(Image: TV Grab)

Alex didn't let the setback ruin her routine and received high praise from all of the judges before getting a score of 34.

Praising Alex after the performance, Kevin said: "Then having to teach a to do the dance in 45 minutes. Everyone can probably see I got a few things wrong in that and Alex kept the whole thing going on her own."

Speaking to Claudia afterwards, Kevin admitted: "I literally went out and blanked in the middle of the routine and got it all wrong. You carried me through, Alex."

*Strictly Come Dancing airs tonight on BBC One at 7.15pm
description: Kevin Clifton stepped in for injured Neil Jones - but some Strictly Come Dancing fans argued Gorka Marques should have got the call up
